Key Match Events: Detroit Tigers earned an AL wild card berth with a 4-1 win over the Chicago White Sox
Pre-Game Insights: Detroit Tigers started strong, winning six of their first seven games. They had a winning record until mid-May, when the team started to slide in the standings.
Post-Match Reflections: The Tigers have been on a tear, winning six straight and 10 of 11 to surge into the playoffs
Miscellaneous Highlights: Detroit broke a scoreless tie in the fifth inning with a run that was scored when Jared Shuster was charged with a wild pitch even though the ball didn't hit the dirt just below catcher Korey Lee's glove.
Others: Detroit went into the season expecting to contend for a spot in the playoffs in a second full season under president of basketball operations Scott Harris and A.J. Hinch's fourth year as manager.
